An xV generally does not know what entities own the references to it; it only knows how many references there are, which is the reference count.

trans-unit.source: one restarts iteration. Each hash or array has its own internal iterator, accessed by each, keys, and values. The iterator is implicitly reset when each has reached the end as just described; it can be explicitly reset by calling keys or values on the hash or array, or by referencing the hash (but not array) in list context. If you add or delete a hash's elements while iterating over it, the effect on the iterator is unspecified; for example, entries may be skipped or duplicated--so don't do that. Exception: It is always safe to delete the item most recently returned by each, so the following code works properly:

trans-unit.source: open2() does not wait for and reap the child process after it exits. Except for short programs where it's acceptable to let the operating system take care of this, you need to do this yourself. This is normally as simple as calling waitpid $pid, 0 when you're done with the process. Failing to do this can result in an accumulation of defunct or "zombie" processes. See waitpid for more information.
trans-unit.target: open2 ()는 자식 프로세스가 종료 된 후 기다리지 않고 다시 가져옵니다. 운영 체제에서이를 처리 할 수있는 짧은 프로그램을 제외하고 직접 수행해야합니다. 프로세스가 끝나면 waitpid $pid, 0 을 호출하는 것만 큼 간단 합니다. 이를 수행하지 않으면 기능이 저하되거나 "좀비"프로세스가 누적 될 수 있습니다. 자세한 내용은 waitpid 를 참조하십시오.

trans-unit.source: open2() does not wait for and reap the child process after it exits. Except for short programs where it's acceptable to let the operating system take care of this, you need to do this yourself. This is normally as simple as calling waitpid $pid, 0 when you're done with the process. Failing to do this can result in an accumulation of defunct or "zombie" processes. See "waitpid" in perlfunc for more information.

open2() returns the process ID of the child process. It doesn't return on failure: it just raises an exception matching /^open2:/ . However, exec failures in the child are not detected. You'll have to trap SIGPIPE yourself.
trans-unit.target: open2 ()는 자식 프로세스의 프로세스 ID를 반환합니다. 실패시 리턴되지 않습니다 . /^open2:/ 일치하는 예외가 발생 합니다. 그러나 하위의 exec 실패는 감지되지 않습니다. SIGPIPE를 직접 잡아야합니다.

trans-unit.source: open2() returns the process ID of the child process. It doesn't return on failure: it just raises an exception matching /^open2:/. However, exec failures in the child are not detected. You'll have to trap SIGPIPE yourself.

open3() does not wait for and reap the child process after it exits. Except for short programs where it's acceptable to let the operating system take care of this, you need to do this yourself. This is normally as simple as calling waitpid $pid, 0 when you're done with the process. Failing to do this can result in an accumulation of defunct or "zombie" processes. See waitpid for more information.

trans-unit.source: open3() does not wait for and reap the child process after it exits. Except for short programs where it's acceptable to let the operating system take care of this, you need to do this yourself. This is normally as simple as calling waitpid $pid, 0 when you're done with the process. Failing to do this can result in an accumulation of defunct or "zombie" processes. See "waitpid" in perlfunc for more information.

open3() returns the process ID of the child process. It doesn't return on failure: it just raises an exception matching /^open3:/ . However, exec failures in the child (such as no such file or permission denied), are just reported to CHLD_ERR under Windows and OS/2, as it is not possible to trap them.
trans-unit.target: open3 ()은 자식 프로세스의 프로세스 ID를 반환합니다. 실패시 리턴되지 않습니다 . /^open3:/ 일치하는 예외가 발생 합니다. 그러나 하위 파일의 exec 실패 (예 : 해당 파일이 없거나 권한이 거부 됨)는 Windows 및 OS / 2에서 트랩 할 수 없으므로 CHLD_ERR에 방금보고됩니다.

trans-unit.source: open3() returns the process ID of the child process. It doesn't return on failure: it just raises an exception matching /^open3:/. However, exec failures in the child (such as no such file or permission denied), are just reported to $chld_err under Windows and OS/2, as it is not possible to trap them.
opens a filehandle to a newly created empty anonymous temporary file. (This happens under any mode, which makes +> the only useful and sensible mode to use.) You will need to seek to do the reading.

opens a filehandle to an anonymous temporary file. Also using +< works for symmetry, but you really should consider writing something to the temporary file first. You will need to seek() to do the reading.
trans-unit.target: 익명 임시 파일에 대한 파일 핸들을 엽니 다. 또한 +< 를 사용하여 대칭으로 작동하지만 먼저 임시 파일에 무언가를 쓰는 것을 고려해야합니다. 읽기를하려면 seek ()가 필요합니다.

trans-unit.source: opens the UTF8-encoded file containing Unicode characters; see perluniintro. Note that if layers are specified in the three-argument form, then default layers stored in ${^OPEN} (see perlvar; usually set by the open pragma or the switch -CioD) are ignored. Those layers will also be ignored if you specifying a colon with no name following it. In that case the default layer for the operating system (:raw on Unix, :crlf on Windows) is used.

trans-unit.source: operations in Perl. Search and replace is accomplished with the s/// operator. The general form is s/regexp/replacement/modifiers, with everything we know about regexps and modifiers applying in this case as well. The replacement is a Perl double-quoted string that replaces in the string whatever is matched with the regexp . The operator =~ is also used here to associate a string with s///. If matching against $_ , the $_ =~ can be dropped. If there is a match, s/// returns the number of substitutions made; otherwise it returns false. Here are a few examples:
trans-unit.target: Perl의 운영. 검색 및 교체는 s/// 연산자로 수행됩니다 . 일반적인 형식은 s/regexp/replacement/modifiers 이며,이 경우에도 정규 표현식 및 수정 자에 대해 알고있는 모든 내용이 적용됩니다. replacement 문자열을 대체가과 일치 무엇이든 펄 따옴표 문자열입니다 regexp . 여기서 연산자 =~ 는 문자열을 s/// 에 연결하는 데 사용됩니다 . $_ 와 일치 하면 $_ =~ 를 삭제할 수 있습니다. 일치하는 항목이 있으면 s/// 는 대체 횟수를 반환합니다. 그렇지 않으면 false를 반환합니다. 다음은 몇 가지 예입니다.
